Package net.greg.examples.salient.antipatterns

Class Chime

java.lang.Object
net.greg.examples.salient.antipatterns.Chime
public final class Chime
extends java.lang.Object
The Singleton antipattern!

  • Field Details

    • INSTANCE

      public static final Chime INSTANCE
      The Java JSL states that a constructor cannot publish an instance of a class until all final instance (and static/class) attributes are reified. This language construct - final - is the key to affording this Singleton class thread-safe instantiation.

    • createdTime

      private java.time.LocalDateTime createdTime

  • Constructor Details

    • Chime

      private Chime()
      The following statement in this method disables Reflection:
      System.setSecurityManager( new SecurityManager());
      ... but it also disables key permissions. For this application, the above statement affects certain programmatic Threading permissions/capabilities. Specifically, the app loses the (vital) ability to preserve the current Thread-of-execution's interrupt status, which is accomplished via the following canonical, static method:
      Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
      When needed, the rescission of this permission can be reversed/overridden by affordance of an entry in this canonical file: $HOME/.java.policy The other permissions/capabilites export the JVM's metadata, and can be reversed, too. To programmatically (at will) reinstate the capability to restore a Thread's interrupt status, add the next statement to this file: $HOME/.java.policy The statement is:
      grant { permission java.lang.RuntimePermission "modifyThread"; };
      See Also:
      Watch#drainPool

  • Method Details

    • createdTime

      public final java.lang.String createdTime()

    • currentTime

      public final java.lang.String currentTime()
      Stateless (not stored here) issuance of the current time back to the dependent code that invoked this method. Appends an empty string, which coerces the toString() method of LocalDateTime instance to be evaluated.

    • readObject

      private void readObject​(java.io.ObjectInputStream ois) throws java.lang.RuntimeException
      Lifecycle Consideration: This method is invoked during serialization, but we stop serialization of this class because logically, the state of a ('Singleton') is invalid across address spaces.
      Parameters:
      ois - ObjectInputStream
      Throws:
      java.lang.RuntimeException

    • writeObject

      private void writeObject​(java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos) throws java.lang.RuntimeException

      Parameters:

      Throws:
